title: 毒檸北海道之出走只會更抑鬱

replies.msg:
話說小弟失戀，同拍拖三年嘅不歡而散，加上工作壓力大，朋友唔多 (白羊仔睇友誼睇得好重)，屋企人關係又唔好，身邊嘅朋友都同我講叫我見下社工，因為經常崩潰大喊又想自殺了結生命，所以想襯NPL去日本散下心，我其實唔多鐘意自己一個出行，因為冇得分享食好西睇靚景嗰種喜悅比旅伴係好sad，咁算啦，反正想襯呢個時候反省下，閲讀下自己，所以去11日北海道玩

行程係: 函館>大沼>札幌>定山溪>小樽>旭川>美瑛

睇到嘅，歡迎屌醒我，比意見我，1999到得
小弟第一次寫遊記，錯字多嘅話請大家諒解

Day 2-3: 函館
我住嘅係Hostel 有獨立房包早餐，都幾好，始終兩晚岩岩到歩想住好少少

朝日市場
朝早好靜，無曬奶共狗，不過食咗間旅遊書介紹嘅招牌魚生丼，好撚飽



金森赤レンガ倉庫
個天靚，乜都靚，入面就主要係手信鋪多，但個海港望出去以為自己去咗歐洲




八幡坡
聽講係全日本最浪漫最靚嘅坡道，仲要黐埋啲積雪係兩邊直望係海港口，世界級！


五棱郭塔 公園



湯倉神社


函館夜景
聽聞係同香港並列嘅世界三大夜景之一


大沼國定公園
話說啱啱完咗雪祭之後諗住入去散個靚步，點知唯一出入嗰條橋仔維修，咁正常你唔會因為條橋維修而行唔到入邊架嘛，點知個維修架佬話你入唔到去架啦，ok fine咁我就拎住個地圖見到有一條散策路，即係比啲自由嘅行山者行，以我經驗之前自己一個人去倫敦行山dover cliff都掂的話，我估今次可以搏一搏，加上我真係力主部大機唔想嘥咗咁靚嘅天氣，咁我就出番個大門口兜咗個大圈在由公路側邊嗰啲小路闖入去，點知比我發現呢個咁驚人嘅靚景，其實全程都好危險因為一個人都冇，啲雪起碼去到我腳眼，我唯一係行到中間發現有少少行過嘅腳印，應該係幾日前嘅，就跟着腳印行，行返入嗰條大會指定嘅trail，得咗。
要凍既去北歐算啦 而家咁既時勢
原本有打算喺大沼嗰條橋跳河自盡，不過跳河結左冰咁厚雪咁應該死唔去
好似好正 完全冇人

巴打加油

去到個天氣都好好
大沼個湖都冰封晒, 但佢有圍住叫人唔准行落去?

There's a pageant of which the final round will take place in Hokkaido. I would've thought Aiko is highly likely to enter the final. My friend Yoshida said "My bet is Fumi will enter the final" My friend Risa has got a commission to compose a waltz for the pageant because one of the contestants will be showcasing her waltz dance which we all can't wait to see. I offer heartfelt congratulations to her for having received a commission for a waltz from the pageant since it's a rare opportunity. I should also like to express my congratulations to my friend Kawai on having progressed through the preliminary round. She's a contestant in the beauty contest and I won't be surprised if she progresses through the semifinal. I remember a decade ago there was a protest where the protestors clashed with the police in Osaka. I saw it on NHK then. I thought the police weren't tough enough. All the riot police were holding a shield in one hand and a truncheon in the other hand. In this way you can't really fight the protestors since you have no free hands to grab ahold of them. That's why it took four policemen to get hold of one demonstrator. From a fighting viewpoint, some of the riot police should be holding just a shield, some just a nightstick, the other both. And all of them should be trained as to how they fight when they're holding just a shield, holding just a baton and holding both. It was utter chaos. I didn't think Osaka had ever been so disastrous before. The police who I wholeheartedly supported only used tear smoke in an attempt to disperse the demonstrators which was clearly not enough. The police shouldn't have been afraid of being criticised for using excessive force as it was utterly not the case. Firing rubber bullets and bean bags at the demonstrators was necessary, lawful and appropriate.  Those who sabotaged the nearby buildings and the railings should've been sent to jail. The train network was partially paralysed for many weeks. The world had brought the city to the edge of a catastrophe. The United states had already imposed trade sanctions on Japan at that time. The then united states president said he would take punitive action if the police there used excessive force. Japan was afraid that America would toughen punitive import duties still further on alcohol, agricultural products, clothes and food and worse still, they would convince other nations to impose international economic sanctions against the country. Of course, the downside was the costs of the products in America which they had imposed punitive import tariffs on would rise still higher. The economic sanctions against Japan wouldn't be lifted until the then US president's presidency expired a year later. The next day everyone was warned of the danger of violent clashes around the place only to discover that it was a false alarm. There were half as many people in the street. However as long as you kept up with the news and stayed away from places where there were demonstrations, Osaka was safe. On the same day, a bus crash killed twenty three passengers. Detectives assigned the blame for the bus accident to a hailstorm and heavy snowfalls. I expressed my condolences to the families of the people who died in the accident- and then a brutal murder took place in the capital. Detectives assigned jealousy and hatred as the motives for the horrendous crime.
